nodes.text: In 3666 BBY, the Jedi Knight Satele Shan bore her child, Theron, on a planet far from the reach of the Great Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the reconstituted Sith Empire. With the help of Jedi Master Ngani Zho, Shan gave birth to her son in a cave on the planet's surface, though she gave up Theron to be raised by Zho while she returned to the battlefront. The planet also featured a breathable atmosphere as well as trees and other foliage, and the sky was an orange color.

This unnamed planet first appeared in a single panel in The Old Republic—The Lost Suns 4, a comic issue written by Alexander Freed and released in 2011, in which Zho remembers when Satele gave him Theron. It later appeared in the prologue of Drew Karpyshyn's 2012 novel The Old Republic: Annihilation, which featured Shan giving birth to her son, the protagonist of the novel.
